name: Ingvild Indrebø
title: Can you hear me now? Saying goodbye to clumsy video calls thanks to code.
description:
Almost every video call begins with the same clumsy questions. Can you hear me now? Did I just turn off my camera instead of my mic now? But what if we could take the awkward troubleshooting out of the conversation, and solve it with code instead?

In this talk, Ingvild Indrebø will give you a glimpse into aspects of WebRTC, WebAudio and Canvas, by showing you how she used these technologies to build a user-friendly and accessible tool to make sure you’re all set for your video call.
Outline
The opening will be an introduction to the familiar situation of non-working video calls.
The talk itself will have three main parts, with a very brief intro to the tech we used, but focusing on how we used each technology in the final user flow, and what we learned on the way.

The first part is focused on WebRTC which is used to access video and audio from the user.
The second part is focused on WebAudio, and how we use that to make sure the user’s microphone is working.
The third is focused on Canvas, which we use to visualize audio input and output.

name: You?
title: Your talk title
description: This is your spot to take! We want to hear your story. Get in touch with us and we're happy to host you!
